citation.article-title: Sporosarcina contaminans sp. nov. and Sporosarcina thermotolerans sp. nov., two endospore-forming species
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sporosarcina contaminans sp. nov.
Sporosarcina contaminans (con.ta′mi.nans. L. part. adj. contaminans contaminating, polluting, isolated as a contaminant of an industrial clean-room floor).
Cells are Gram-positive, strictly aerobic, motile rods (0.8–1.0×2.0–3.0 μm).
Spherical endospores are formed in a terminal position.
Colonies grown on TSA are circular, convex and beige.
Optimal temperature for growth is 30 °C; growth occurs at 15–50 °C, but not at 5 or 55 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0–8.0; growth occurs at pH 6.5–10.5.
NaCl is not required for growth, but can be tolerated up to 9 % (w/v).
Positive for catalase and oxidase activities.
Gelatin and starch are not hydrolysed.
H2S, indole and acetoin are not produced.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Negative for urease, gelatinase, β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase and citrate utilization.
No acid formation from sugars is observed.
Sugar compounds in the API 50CH gallery are not utilized.
Some organic acids, such as pyruvate, fumarate and l-malate, are utilized according to the method of Kämpfer et al. (1991).
Further physiological data are indicated in Table 1.
The peptidoglycan is of type A4α l-Lys–d-Glu and the major menaquinone is MK-7.
The polar lipid profile consists of the major lipids diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylethanolamine.
Major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0; iso-C14 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0 are also detected.
The type strain is CCUG 53915T (=DSM 22204T), isolated as a contaminant from an industrial clean-room floor in Göteborg, Sweden.
